Original meaning 本义: Meaning husband.

郒字的基本解释

郒
láng
古同“郎”。

郒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［láng］
［《廣韻》魯當切，平唐，來。］
亦作“郒1”。“郞1”的新字形。
(1)官名。战国时已有，秦汉时沿置，有议郎、中郎、侍郎、郎中等，员额无定。均属于郎中令（后改为光禄勋）。其职责原为护卫陪从，随时建议、备顾问及差遣。东汉以尚书台为实际的行政中枢，其分曹任事者为尚书郎，职责范围与过去的郎官不同。后遂以侍郎、郎中、员外郎为各部要职。
(2)青少年男子的通称。
(3)对他人之子的敬称。
(4)女婿。
(5)旧时妇女对丈夫或情人的称呼。
(6)对男子的敬称。
(7)偶亦用作自称。
(8)旧时奴仆对主人的称呼。
(9)北朝人子呼其父称郎。
(10)明时称微贱者。
(11)称僧。
(12)明清时苗族称兵士。
(13)副词。犹很，非常。
(14)通“廊”。参见“郎臺”。
(15)春秋鲁地名。㈠鲁边邑。故地在今山东省鱼台县东北。《左传·隐公元年》：“夏四月，費伯帥帥城郎。”杜预注：“郎，魯邑。高平方與縣東南有郁郎亭。”㈡春秋鲁地名。鲁近邑。故地在今山东省曲阜市附近。《礼记·檀弓下》：

Xi
Basic explanation of words
Xi
láng
Ancient Tong "lang".
Xi
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［láng］
["Guangyun" Lu Dangqie, Ping Tang, come. ]
Also known as "Yu 1". The new glyph of "Yun 1".
(1) Official name. During the Warring States period, it was established during the Qin and Han Dynasties. There were Yilang, Zhonglang, Shilang, Lang and so on, and the number of posts was not fixed. All belonged to the Langzhong Order (later changed to Guangluxun). Originally, his duty was to escort and accompany him, making recommendations, preparing consultants and dispatching at any time. The Eastern Han Dynasty took Shangshutai as the actual administrative center, and its subordinates were Shangshulang, whose scope of responsibility was different from that of the former Langguan. Later, the ministers, doctors, and Yuanwailang were appointed as important positions in the various ministries.
(2) Generic term for young men.
(3) The honorific title for the son of others.
(4) Son-in-law.
(5) The old women's name for husband or lover.
(6) Honorific title for men.
(7) Occasionally also used as self-proclaimed.
(8) The old slave's address to the master.
(9) The sons of the Northern Dynasties called their fathers Lang.
(10) Those who are called humble in the future.
(11) Said monk.
(12) During the Ming and Qing Dynasties, the Miao people were called soldiers.
(13) Adverbs. Still very, very.
(14) Through the "corridor". See "Lang Tai".
(15) Spring and Autumn Lu place names. (1) Lubian town. The old place was in the northeast of Yutai County, Shandong Province. "Zuo Zhuan·Yin AD": "Xia April, Faber handsome and handsome Cheng Lang." Du pre-annotated: "Lang, Lu Yi. There is Yulang Pavilion in Gaoping and the southeast of the county." (ii) Spring and Autumn Lu place name. Lu Jinyi. The old place was near Qufu City, Shandong Province. "Book of Rites: Under the Tan Gong":
